items.title: Microsoft Majorana 1 Topological Quantum Chip Unveiled

content.abstract: Microsoft unveiled Majorana 1, the world's first quantum chip powered by Topological Core architecture, potentially solving the decoherence problem that has plagued qubit stability.

items.title: Gold Breaches $5,000 Amid Fed Pivot Expectations and Dollar Weakness

content.abstract: Gold prices breached $5,000/oz for the first time as NFP tension fuels aggressive Fed pivot bets. Markets pricing in multiple rate cuts throughout 2026.

items.title: Geoeconomic Confrontation Named World's Top Risk for 2026 by WEF

content.abstract: WEF: 18% of surveyed leaders identified geoeconomic confrontation as the most likely trigger of a global crisis, ranking above misinformation, polarization, extreme weather, and armed conflict.

items.title: US Jobs Report: 130K Added in January, Structural Labor Market Challenges

content.abstract: US employers added 130,000 jobs in January 2026. Structural challenges: older workers prolonging retirement, younger generation disengagement, declining immigration. US projected to add only 23M people in next 30 years vs 70M in previous 30.

items.title: EPA Eliminates 2009 Clean Air Act Endangerment Finding

content.abstract: EPA eliminating 2009 endangerment finding — the legal basis for most federal climate regulations. Removal could dismantle the regulatory framework for greenhouse gas emissions control.

items.title: New START Nuclear Treaty Expires — Last US-Russia Arms Control Agreement Ending

content.abstract: New START expires in February 2026 — the last nuclear arms control treaty between US and Russia with no successor agreement in sight.

items.title: Cerebras Systems Raises $1B at $23B Valuation for AI Chip Alternative

content.abstract: AI chipmaker Cerebras raised $1B at $23B valuation, signaling investor appetite for Nvidia alternatives. Wafer-scale processors offer fundamentally different architecture from GPU-based approaches.

items.title: WHO: Four in Ten Cancer Cases Globally Could Be Prevented

content.abstract: WHO/IARC global analysis: 40% of cancer cases could be prevented. First study to include 9 cancer-causing infections among 30 preventable causes.

items.title: China Clean Energy Drives Over One-Third of 2025 GDP Growth; Solar/Wind Surpasses Coal

content.abstract: Solar, EVs, and clean energy drove over a third of China's GDP growth in 2025. Wind and solar capacity surpassed coal for first time in China's power mix. Oxford study: renewables shift by 2050 could save $12 trillion.

items.title: Personalized Gene Editing: Baby KJ First to Receive Custom CRISPR Treatment

content.abstract: Baby KJ became the first person to receive personalized gene-editing treatment using CRISPR. Named 2026 Breakthrough Technology. Clinical trials planned for bespoke gene-editing drugs.

items.title: US Federal Judge Rules Secret Climate Panel 'Unlawful'

content.abstract: Federal judge ruled DOE violated the law when Secretary Wright handpicked climate-skeptic researchers for secret government climate report, bypassing scientific advisory processes.

items.title: Stanford Optical Cavities Enable Scalable Quantum Networking

content.abstract: Stanford miniature optical cavities efficiently collect light from individual atoms, enabling simultaneous qubit reading. Demonstrated arrays with hundreds of cavities for scalable quantum networking.

items.title: Global CBDC Race: Russia, Brazil, EU Advance Digital Currency Launches

content.abstract: Multiple CBDCs advancing: Russia Digital Ruble from Sept 2026, Brazil Drex in two phases, ECB digital euro, BoE Digital Pound Lab. Transforming global monetary infrastructure.

items.title: EU Regulators Target Meta Over AI Assistant Treatment on WhatsApp (DMA)

content.abstract: EU regulators signaled interim measures over Meta's handling of rival AI assistants on WhatsApp, escalating DMA enforcement over platform-level AI gatekeeping.

items.title: Sodium-Ion Batteries: Cheaper, Safer Alternative to Lithium Emerging

content.abstract: Sodium-ion batteries from salt are emerging as cheaper, safer lithium alternative. Named 2026 Breakthrough. Poised to power grids and affordable EVs worldwide.

items.title: Artemis II Moon Mission Delayed to March Due to Hydrogen Leak

content.abstract: Artemis II postponed to NET March 6, 2026 after hydrogen leak during wet dress rehearsal. First crewed mission beyond LEO since Apollo 17.

items.title: AI Trustworthiness: From Principles to Operational Necessity in 2026

content.abstract: Trustworthy AI shifts from abstract aspiration to operational necessity. Autonomy threshold legislation being considered for determining required human oversight levels.

items.title: Mechanistic Interpretability Named 2026 Breakthrough Technology

content.abstract: Mechanistic interpretability — mapping features and pathways across AI models — named 2026 Breakthrough. Anthropic pioneered prompt-to-response tracing. Shift from black-box to transparent AI.

items.title: Anthropic Study: AI-Assisted Engineers Learn 25% Less Despite Faster Completion

content.abstract: Anthropic study: AI-assisted engineers achieved 50% quiz mastery vs 67% for manual group. Raises fundamental questions about AI's impact on human skill development and knowledge retention.

items.title: Global Energy Storage to Exceed 100GW for First Time in 2026

content.abstract: Annual global storage installations to exceed 100GW in 2026. EV sales overtook petrol in EU Dec 2025. 90%+ of new renewables cheaper than fossil fuels. CO2 bubble battery stores 200 MWh.

items.title: Jimmy Lai Sentenced to 20 Years Under Hong Kong National Security Law

content.abstract: Pro-democracy media tycoon Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years under China-imposed security law. Landmark case in erosion of Hong Kong's press freedom.

items.title: Nearly 800 New Deep-Sea Species Found Before Pacific Seabed Mining

content.abstract: Five-year Pacific expedition documented ~800 species, many unknown, in mining-targeted areas. Urgent biodiversity questions as critical mineral demand surges.

items.title: H-2B Visa Program Expanded by 64,716 Visas for FY2026

content.abstract: DHS expanded H-2B temporary worker visa program by 64,716 additional visas for FY2026, signaling persistent labor shortages in seasonal industries.

items.title: Portugal: Center-Left Defeats Far-Right in Presidential Runoff

content.abstract: Center-left Socialist Seguro won landslide over hard-right populist Ventura in Portugal presidential runoff. Contrasts with far-right gains elsewhere in Europe.

items.title: US Patent Applications Drop 9% After Record High; Cell Technology Surges

content.abstract: US patent applications decreased 9% in 2025 after record highs. Samsung led with 7,054 grants (+11% YoY). Cell-related tech fastest growing (+23% over 4 years).

items.title: ILO: Global Jobs Gap Reaches 408 Million in 2026 Despite Stable Unemployment

content.abstract: ILO Employment and Social Trends 2026 report reveals global jobs gap (people wanting paid work but unable to access it) projected at 408 million. Official unemployment at 4.9% (186M) masks structural exclusion: 300M in extreme poverty, 2.1B in informal employment. Women 24.2% less likely to participate in labor force. 260M youth (20%) not in employment, education, or training. Employment growth diverging by income level: 0.5% in upper-middle vs 3.1% in low-income countries.

items.classification_reasoning: ILO flagship report on global employment and social trends directly addresses demographic, labor, and social inequality issues -- core Social domain.

items.title: Climate Models Missing Key Ocean Player: Plankton Shallow Dissolution Underestimated

content.abstract: Marine plankton building calcium carbonate shells play outsized role in regulating Earth's climate, but largely missing from climate models. Much calcium carbonate produced by plankton does not sink to ocean floor but dissolves in upper ocean ('shallow dissolution'). This process is underrepresented in climate forecasting models, potentially skewing carbon cycle projections.

items.classification_reasoning: Climate modeling gap involving marine biology -- Environmental domain. Scientific finding with implications for climate prediction accuracy.

items.title: FDA Clears First Human Trial of Epigenetic Reprogramming Anti-Aging Therapy

content.abstract: FDA approved first-ever human clinical trial of epigenetic reprogramming therapy (Life Biosciences' ER-100). Uses three Yamanaka factors (OSK) to reset age-associated epigenetic markers while preserving cell identity. Targets age-related eye diseases (glaucoma, NAION). Excludes c-Myc to lower tumor risk. Cofounded by Harvard's David Sinclair. Phase 1 enrollment starting Feb 2026. Historic milestone: first translation of partial cellular rejuvenation from lab to human patients.

items.classification_reasoning: Biotechnology breakthrough -- first human trial of anti-aging gene therapy. Technological domain with spiritual/ethical implications.

items.title: Deep-Sea Chiton Named by Public Vote: 8,000 Submissions for Rare Species

content.abstract: Newly identified deep-sea chiton named Ferreiraella populi through public naming competition with 8,000+ submissions. Campaign began after science YouTuber Ze Frank featured the rare creature. Represents growing citizen science engagement and public interest in deep-sea biodiversity, coinciding with debates over seabed mining in the Clarion-Clipperton Zone.

items.classification_reasoning: Citizen science and public engagement in biodiversity -- Social domain (cultural, educational dimension of science-society relationship).

items.title: NASA Perseverance Achieves AI-Driven Autonomous Navigation: 450m Without Human Input

content.abstract: NASA used AI to generate waypoints for Perseverance rover's route on two separate days, with the rover driving over 450 meters autonomously without human input. Represents significant step toward greater autonomy for planetary exploration rovers, reducing Earth-to-Mars communication delays from decision-making loop.

items.classification_reasoning: AI-driven autonomous space exploration technology -- Technological domain combining AI and space exploration frontiers.
